ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] re: Class Balance
ygData.msgSnippet: oops, sorry meant 22 (I didn t start using it till level 28) ... From: Adam Wasserman  To:  Sent: Monday, March 20,
ygData.messageBody:
oops, sorry meant 22 (I didn't start using it till level 28)
----- Original Message -----
From: "Adam Wasserman" <wassermana@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Monday, March 20, 2000 12:21 PM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] re: Class Balance


> From: "Adam Wasserman" <wassermana@...>
>
> Rangers don't get harmony until 22. Was it different in beta?
>
> Draelon
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Kevin L. Crawford [mailto:Lyrnia@...]
> Sent: Monday, March 20, 2000 11:47 AM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqbards] re: Class Balance
>
>
> From: "Kevin L. Crawford" <Lyrnia@...>
>
> Harmony was not fixed until early final. Sometime around June. I think
> it's likely that he played during beta (where we all learned to do without
> Harmony and a few other spells that were broken/not implemented at the
> time.). Because of this he may just never have bothered learning it when
he
> got the chance in final. Or he asked friends who played during beta and
was
> told "It's broken, don't bother"
>
> I myself fell victim to the 'beta mentality' and when my ranger had the
> chance to get harmony at 15 never used it until my mid 20's.... go figure.
> Once I realized it actually worked I was thrilled. To top all that off
most
> of the sites listing spell effects were just cloning older lists made
during
> beta. None reflected that harmony worked correctly (nor what it did)
until
> late summer.
>
> Kind of funny.
>
> Lyrnia
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: "Kimes, Dean W." <dean_kimes@...>
> To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
> Sent: Monday, March 20, 2000 11:12 AM
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] re: Class Balance
>
>
> > From: "Kimes, Dean W." <dean_kimes@...>
> >
> > Really? I've been using harmony successfully for months. How could he
> fail
> > to find out it worked for that long? when did it get fixed?
> >
> > Kit
> >
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Perhaps a Princess... [mailto:sarah@...]
> > Sent: Sunday, March 19, 2000 2:25 AM
> > To: eqbards@onelist.com
> > Subject: RE: [eqbards] re: Class Balance
> >
> >
> > From: "Perhaps a Princess..." <sarah@...>
> >
> > Note: For the longest time, Harmony did absolutely nothing and was
> > worthless at a spell. I bought it because I am a completist and I
> > wanted everything. At some time, they did a "silent de-nerf" and
> > made Harmony more than do something -- but actually be WORTH
> > using. It is possible, if he doesn't read the net, this druid
> > tried Harmony/heard from like levels that it was worthless and
> > thus never actually bought it... and has not been doing outside
> > stuff with groups since that someone mentioned "Hey, Harmony
> > -works- now"
> >
> > >-----Original Message-----
> > >From: Garramone, Michael (CCI-Las Vegas)
> > >Sent: Saturday, March 18, 2000 11:00 AM
> >
> > >hehehe ok i like this topic... here is one for you all. in
butcherblock
> > >killing dwarven citizens (it's cheesy but easy, hey that rhymes) i met
a
> > >level 40 druid. he asked me to help him split up 2 dwarves who were
> > >together. it seemed strange being a druid and all, so i just said use
> > >harmony. he said: "i'm gonna go buy it."
> > >
> > >Shada Powa, L50 Wood Elf Bard
> > >Tyria Sarkin, L48 High Elf Wizard
> > ><Afterlife> Mithaniel Marr Server
> >
> > Sarah Heacock sarah@...
> > Faerain Wanderer, level 20 Soldier of Tunare, Phoenix, Solusek Ro /
> > Faesong, level 15 HalfElf Bard of Solusek Ro, Phoenix, Solusek Ro
> (Freeport)
> > /
> > Meara, level 14 Enchanter, Master Jeweler, owner Meara's Boutique of
> > Mystiques, Phoenix, Solusek Ro /
> > <lvl 5 paladin>
